Method Detail

calcNormalColor

public ColorCafe calcNormalColor(double nc,
                                 double nr,
                                 double nu,
                                 double bumpHeight)
Calculates the normal vector at a given point on the noise map.

Parameters:
nc - The height of the given point in the noise map.
nr - The height of the left neighbor.
nu - The height of the up neighbor.
bumpHeight - The bump height.
Returns:
The normal vector represented as a color. This method encodes the (x, y, z) components of the normal vector into the (red, green, blue) channels of the returned color. In order to represent the vector as a color, each coordinate of the normal is mapped from the -1.0 to 1.0 range to the 0 to 255 range. The bump height specifies the ratio of spatial resolution to elevation resolution. For example, if your noise map has a spatial resolution of 30 meters and an elevation resolution of one meter, set the bump height to 1.0 / 30.0. The spatial resolution and elevation resolution are determined by the application.

render

public void render()
            throws ExceptionInvalidParam
Renders the noise map to the destination image.

Throws:
ExceptionInvalidParam

enableWrap

public void enableWrap(boolean enable)
Enables or disables noise-map wrapping.

Parameters:
enable - A flag that enables or disables noise-map wrapping. This object requires three points (the initial point and the right and up neighbors) to calculate the normal vector at that point. If wrapping is/ enabled, and the initial point is on the edge of the noise map, the appropriate neighbors that lie outside of the noise map will "wrap" to the opposite side(s) of the noise map. Otherwise, the appropriate neighbors are cropped to the edge of the noise map. Enabling wrapping is useful when creating spherical and tileable normal maps.

getBumpHeight

public double getBumpHeight()
Returns the bump height.

Returns:
The bump height. The bump height specifies the ratio of spatial resolution to elevation resolution. For example, if your noise map has a spatial resolution of 30 meters and an elevation resolution of one meter, set the bump height to 1.0 / 30.0. The spatial resolution and elevation resolution are determined by the application.

isWrapEnabled

public boolean isWrapEnabled()
Determines if noise-map wrapping is enabled.

Returns:
- @a true if noise-map wrapping is enabled. - @a false if noise-map wrapping is disabled. This object requires three points (the initial point and the right and up neighbors) to calculate the normal vector at that point. If wrapping is/ enabled, and the initial point is on the edge of the noise map, the appropriate neighbors that lie outside of the noise map will "wrap" to the opposite side(s) of the noise map. Otherwise, the appropriate neighbors are cropped to the edge of the noise map. Enabling wrapping is useful when creating spherical and tileable normal maps.

setBumpHeight

public void setBumpHeight(double bumpHeight)
Sets the bump height.

Parameters:
bumpHeight - The bump height. The bump height specifies the ratio of spatial resolution to elevation resolution. For example, if your noise map has a spatial resolution of 30 meters and an elevation resolution of one meter, set the bump height to 1.0 / 30.0. The spatial resolution and elevation resolution are determined by the application.

setDestImage

public void setDestImage(ImageCafe destImage)
Sets the destination image.

Parameters:
destImage - The destination image. The destination image will contain the normal map after a successful call to the render() method. The destination image must exist throughout the lifetime of this object unless another image replaces that image.

setSourceNoiseMap

public void setSourceNoiseMap(NoiseMap sourceNoiseMap)
Sets the source noise map.

Parameters:
sourceNoiseMap - The source noise map. The destination image must exist throughout the lifetime of this object unless another image replaces that image.
